greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of solid standard Young tableaux of shape [[n,k],[n-k]]; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is odd if and only if n = 2^i-1 for i in {0, 1, 2, ... } = A001477.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
S. B. Ekhad, D. Zeilberger, Computational and Theoretical Challenges on Counting Solid Standard Young Tableaux, arXiv:1202.6229v1 [math.CO], 2012
maple: b:= proc(x, y, z) option remember; `if`(z>y, b(x, z, y),
mathematica: b[x_, y_, z_] := b[x, y, z] = If[z>y, b[x, z, y], If[Union[{x, y, z}] == {0}, 1, If[x>y && x>z, b[x-1, y, z], 0] + If[y>0, b[x, y-1, z], 0] + If[z>0, b[x, y, z-1], 0]]]; T[n_, k_] := b[n, k, n-k]; Table[T[n, k] , {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 15 2014, translated from Maple *)
program: if z > y : return B(x, z, y)
if x==y and y==z and z==0 : return 1
a = B(x-1, y, z) if x>y and x>z else 0
b = B(x, y-1, z) if y>0 else 0
c = B(x, y, z-1) if z>0 else 0
T = lambda n, k: B(n, k, n-k)
[[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..10)]
# After Maple code of Alois P. Heinz. _Peter Luschny_, Jul 30 2012
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 28 2012
